txt.en: 'Tell me, Núrzum, have you come to appreciate this opportunity?'
'I asked for the strength to survive my wounds, the ability to return to the cold of the Misty Mountains...'
'The gifts I have bestowed upon you?'
'... and the chance to seek revenge against the Men that harried me in my travels.'
'You are not of your kind any longer, Núrzum...'
'All that remains now is to uphold your end of our arrangement.'
Instance: Man and Monster
'You knew as much when I came upon you in this forest, wounded and lost as you were.'
'I have done naught but fulfill everything promised to you...'
'You are something far greater than before, but you must remember, my friend... that you serve me.'
'Where then have I failed? All of those are within your grasp now.'
'I gave you strength through the roots that now wind about your stones...'
'And the Men? They cannot stand against you any longer...'
'I granted you a snow-covered home no matter where your travels take you...'
'At their crude camp, where remnants of Brúndoron's roots still laid hewn in the earth, Núrzum stood amongst fearful Orcs.'
'His wrath had not yet visited the forest directly, but the stone he carried upon his back had already brought thick snowfall to the lands around him....'
'Núrzum stood waiting, not knowing when his friend would arrive, and lost in what he was to do with his newfound might.'
'In the distance, the harsh weather seemed to split as a man strode forth through the snowfall...'
'Gifts?! What gifts, Wizard?'
'It has...'
'As the snow swirled around him, the man's robes seemed to shimmer with myriad colours, and Núrzum knew at once his powerful ally had returned.'
'Even my own kind would not look upon me now...'
'I returned to the forest as you bid me, and... I am prepared to stand against those that would oppose me.'
'Your words are convincing, Wizard. Of that, there is no doubt.'
'What would you ask of me before I make these lands my home?'
'It shall be done, master. Let these puny Men regret the day they pushed me from their lands!'
'You will slay the leaders of this land to the last.'
'Cynegar, Aldstan, the knight Thrymm... remember them well.
'As for the Reeve, Gárwig, leave his family in shambles.'
'Long has it been, my large friend.'
'Slay Gárnoth, Edsig, Gárferth, Cuthbald, and Gársig...'
'Leave him in ruin, and let him never again pose a threat to you!'
'That is all I ask of you, Núrzum.'
'As I had hoped, friend.'
'Now, journey through the forest and visit your frozen terror upon all that would stand against you!'
'May all of Rohan freeze in your wake!'
